@salimo,

This error can occur for several reasons, but the most common is related to the user that you are trying to share the report with not existing in SAC. This can be checked by following the steps in this KBA: https://me.sap.com/notes/2989998/E

If you can confirm that the user exists in SAC, there are other possible root causes as listed in this KBA: https://me.sap.com/notes/3621006/E

Hopefully one of these can resolve your issue. If not, I'd advise you to open a ticket after checking the KBA's for additional root causes.

entry.title: Dynamically setting chart positions based on measure values
entry.content:
The 4 KPIs (numeric point charts) are dynamically positioned left to right based on the measure value they contain.
  Highest on the left , lowest at the far right.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Setup overview
1. Script variable: 'charts'   type: chart    array: true

2. Onitialisation Script

// populate the dropdown with members of the sales manager dimension
var mem=Chart_1.getDataSource().getMembers("Sales_Manager__5w3m5d06b5");
Dropdown_1.addItem('All');
for (var i=0;i<mem.length;i++)
	{Dropdown_1.addItem(mem[i].id,mem[i].description);}
Dropdown_1.setSelectedKey('All');

//populate the charts script variable with all charts in the story
charts=Application.getWidgets({type:WidgetType.Chart});


3. Dropdown_1 onSelect Script

var key=this.getSelectedKey();
for(var i=0;i<charts.length;i++)	{charts[i].getDataSource().removeDimensionFilter("Sales_Manager__5w3m5d06b5");
	 if(key!=='All') {	 charts[i].getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("Sales_Manager__5w3m5d06b5",key);}}

Timer_1.start(1);

4. Timer_1  onTimeout Script

// re-order charts high to low - left to right

// Step 1: Set up two typed arrays
var chartNames = ArrayUtils.create(Type.Chart);  // chart.getName()
var chartValues = ArrayUtils.create(Type.number); // converted rawValue

// Step 2: Populate both arrays
for (var ia = 0; ia < charts.length; ia++) {
    var name = charts[ia];
    var raw = charts[ia].getDataSource().getResultSet()[0][Alias.MeasureDimension].rawValue;
    var value = ConvertUtils.stringToNumber(raw);

    chartNames.push(name);
    chartValues.push(value);
}

// Step 3: Bubble sort both arrays together — high to low
for (var i = 0; i < chartValues.length - 1; i++) {
    for (var j = 0; j < chartValues.length - i - 1; j++) {
        if (chartValues[j] < chartValues[j + 1]) {
            // Swap values
            var tempVal = chartValues[j];
            chartValues[j] = chartValues[j + 1];
            chartValues[j + 1] = tempVal;

            // Swap corresponding chart names
            var tempName = chartNames[j];
            chartNames[j] = chartNames[j + 1];
            chartNames[j + 1] = tempName;
        }
    }
}

// Define starting position and spacing
var leftPos = 50;         // Starting X position
var spacingGap = 50;      // Gap between charts

// Reposition each chart based on the previous chart's width
for (var iz = 0; iz < chartNames.length; iz++) {
    var chart = chartNames[iz];

    // Set chart left position
    chart.getLayout().setLeft(leftPos);

    // Update leftPos for the next chart
    var chartWidth = chart.getLayout().getWidth().value; // Get current chart width
    leftPos = leftPos + chartWidth + spacingGap;
}

The Chart sorting is placed in a Timer as we need to ensure the data has fully refreshed before trying to retrieve the values and apply the chart sort.

entry.title: Re: Signavio Process Intelligence - SAP ABAP on Prem Syst...
entry.content: @AkumaryafirAk The evidence conclusively points to a misconfiguration of the SAP Java Connector (JCo) used by the On-Premises Extractor, not your SAP user credentials or permissions. The error NOT_FOUND is a classic JCo indicator that it cannot find the specified destination or establish a proper connection context, which the CData driver then misleadingly reports as an "Invalid credentials" error.Your SAP user works in SAP GUI and PO because they use native SAP connectivity libraries. The Signavio Extractor uses a Java-based stack that relies on a correctly configured JCo layer, which is not being set up properly via the Signavio UI alone

entry.title: Re: how to release record that has been created from BAPI...
entry.content:
Please note, when you create a reservation with BAPI_RESERVATION_CREATE1, you are only creating the requirement record in table RESB/RKPF and it does not move stock. That is why you don’t see any change in unrestricted stock. If your goal is to “release” it so that the stock is actually moved from unrestricted to the reservation (or consumed from it), you need to follow up with the appropriate goods movement posting.

Further, in the context of "Release", there’s no separate “release” function for a reservation. The reservation affects available stock immediately (ATP check), but unrestricted stock quantity in MMBE only changes when you post a goods issue against the reservation. If you want to “free” the stock back to unrestricted, you either delete the reservation, or post a goods movement that reverses the reservation consumption.

So to post and clear the Reservation, with the standard transactions like MB1A or MIGO, where select Goods Issue → Reference Document = Reservation. Enter your reservation number, movement type and post. Alternatively, you can also post the stock via BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE

entry.title: Late Stay Hours vs. Varying Operating Times - SAP TM PUDL
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m looking for some guidance to see if anyone has dealt with this scenario before and found a good solution.

Our client has a rule that for sales orders raised with delivery priority 5, the requested delivery date can be extended by 5 days. This extension must respect the customer’s working hours and cannot deliver on weekends.

In the PUDL condition for delivery priority 5, I’ve maintained the operating hours check and added 50 hours of late stay. Since this customer operates 10-hour days, the system correctly calculates the extended requested delivery date.

The challenge is that our client has many customers with different operating hours. Using a standard 50-hour late stay results in inconsistent delivery dates depending on each customer’s operating hours.

Has anyone come across this issue and found a way to consistently apply a set-day rule while still accounting for different operating hours?

Thank you,

entry.title: Re: How can I call a cds odata from ABAP so that it will...
entry.content:
Yes, you can.
But you don’t need to call the OData service. SAP gives us Entity Manipulation Language (EML) in ABAP.

EML is like SQL, but for RAP BO (Behavior Objects).

With EML you can do CREATE / UPDATE / DELETE directly from ABAP.

All the behavior logic (validations, determinations, authorizations) will run automatically.

Suppose you have a RAP BO called Z_I_PLAYER (interface view).

ABAP code will look like this:

DATA lt_update TYPE TABLE FOR UPDATE z_Player.

lt_update = VALUE #(
( %key-uuid = '1234567890ABCDEF'
player_name = 'Virat Kohli'
player_score = 100 )
).

MODIFY ENTITIES OF z_Player
ENTITY player
UPDATE FIELDS ( player_name player_score )
WITH lt_update
FAILED DATA(ls_failed)
REPORTED DATA(ls_reported).

Option 2:
If you want to use the existing Function Module (FM) to update the database table, then remove the COMMIT WORK and ROLLBACK WORK statements from it. Otherwise, the RAP framework will give a runtime error.

If you do not want to remove the COMMIT or ROLLBACK statements from the FM, then call the FM through a SUBMIT program instead.

Regards,

Akshath L.T

entry.title: Re: Auto mail to be Trigger to multiple mail id maintaine...
entry.content:
Retrieving more than one email address from business partner master data is currently not supported.

Please review Chapter 4.2.5 Determining Email Recipients of the Output Management Set-Up Instructions

Currently, the email addresses can be maintained in two places in case several email addresses should be used:

  1. Maintain one email address (default email address) in the business partner master data and
  2. Maintain additional email addresses directly in the step Email Recipient in the Output Parameter Determination app.
    With an excel import/export, also a large number of email addresses can be maintained in the Output Parameter Determination app.

entry.title: Re: TDS provisioning
entry.content:
Hello @Rishav4 

Hello [Customer Name],

Thanks for sharing the details and screenshots.I have analysed the situation, and here's the resolution:

Reverse the incorrect utilisation entry.

Journal Entry 100000083 (₹6,001) requires reversal, as it doesn't match the original provision.

Re-post the utilisation with the correct amount

Repost the utilisation for ₹6,000, which will correctly clear against the original provision (Journal Entry 100000082).

This guarantees a precise match between the provision created and utilised.

Configure rounding difference handling

In Central Business Configuration (CBC), enable automatic posting of rounding differences by assigning a specific rounding difference G/L account (SSCUI 100297).

This prevents minor mismatches of ₹1 from being posted into provisions in the future.

Check assignment logic

In the Manage Journal Entries app, review the Assigned Items of the provision entry to ensure that each provision line is linked only once.

That should prevent the doubling effect you saw (₹12,002) in the assigned values.

Once these steps are complete, the provision cycle will consistently reflect this:

Provision created: ₹6,000

Provision utilised: ₹6,000

Any rounding discrepancies will be automatically recorded in the rounding difference account.

Go ahead with the reversal and reposting and let us know if you'd like us to walk you through the CBC configuration for rounding differences.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: MustUnderstand headers are not understood
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

For integration from Microsoft Application (MS) against SAP ERP system via SAP Cloud Integration system starts got error when  MS side call SOAP service interface after being working well in the last month, the issue starts getting this week on SAP CI Production.

We analysed in detail the issue and we found the followings:

  • the failed messages sent from MS side are not listed in the SAP CI Monitor; just it is found the entries related to the error in the http and trace files:

Entry of HTTP File:

x.x.x.x (x.x.x.x) - - [11/09/2025:10:11:19 +0000] "POST /cxf/productionorder/update HTTP/1.1" 401 104ms - -

Entry of Trace File at 11.09.25: respect to 10:11:19:

2025-09-11 10:11:19#+0000#INFO#com.sap.it.security.multicloud.authentication.AuthConfigurationFactory#anonymous#http-nio2-8080-exec-13#com.sap.it.security.multicloud.authentication#na#na#na#na#Neither client certificate nor Authorization header found. Returning  no auth type#f747460a-2903-477f-5106-92aad8cb5cf7#x.x.x.x#1

  • we have checked that MS Test and Production systems have the SAP CI SSL certificates.
  • we have tested the SOAP Service Interface via Postman manually, and it is got error processing "mustUnderstand=1" attribute as part of the Header of the Payload, based on the error message displayed on Postman:

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">    <soap:Body>        <soap:Fault>            <faultcode>soap:MustUnderstand</faultcode>            <faultstring>MustUnderstand headers: [{http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2005/05/addressing/none}Action] are not understood.</faultstring>        </soap:Fault>    </soap:Body></soap:Envelope>

Nothing was changed (WSDL definition related to the SOAP Service Update Production Order interface or SW update on MA Production side).

We don´t understand why the SOAP Sender Adapter (Communication Channel) is not able to process the new messages suddenly even though have the same structure/content; the "mustUnderstand=1"  Attribute/Value was well process before. This interface was running well on Production until last week.

Any help or hint will be appreciate. Thanks in advance.

Best Regards,

Maria Orellana

entry.title: Re: Tax on Customer Advance and Subsequent Sales
entry.content:
Hi Bohdan,

I am working on a similar requirement for Saudi and UAE where the requirement is to post output tax on the down payment request like as below

Issuance of Advance Tax Invoice:

  • Dr Customer A/R (including tax)                                                             58.95
  • Cr Down Payment Clearing – Special GL (net amount)                              51.26

entry.title: Como criar blogs incríveis a partir das palestras dos eventos SAP?
entry.content:
@moshenaveh compartilhou uma metodologia prática para transformar apresentações de eventos em blogs rápidos e envolventes. Eis os passos-chave:

1️⃣Use o tutorial do SAP Community para habilitar o blogging.
2️⃣Crie um template dedicado ao evento (pré e pós-evento).
3️⃣Transforme sua apresentação em texto com apoio de IA.
4️⃣Revise gramática/estilo com ferramentas de IA.
5️⃣Enriqueça com imagens, slides e mídia.
6️⃣Seja transparente → use a tag GenAIAssistedContent.
7️⃣Publique na seção correta da comunidade.
8️⃣Promova nas redes sociais e interaja nos comentários.

Essa abordagem reduz o tempo de criação de horas para minutos, motiva mais palestrantes a compartilhar conhecimento  e amplia o impacto das sessões.

Que tal aplicar essas dicas no próximo evento que você participar?

Vejam este blog como exemplo criado a partir de palestras realizadas

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 11th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Podcast: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/11/sap-developer-news-september-11th-2025/ 

CAP August 2025 release 

  • Release notes https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/releases/aug25  

ABAP AI - Chapter 2 

  • Blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-ai-chapter-2/ba-p/14210568 

SAP Business Data Cloud Series 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-business-data-cloud-series-part-3-customer-managed-data-products/ba-p/14195545 
  • SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud – a Typical Machine Learning Workflow: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-databricks-in-sap-business-data-cloud-a-typical-machine-learning/ba-p/14206612 
  • Data and AI at Devtoberfest: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events/label-name/data%20analytics%20ai  

Devtoberfest 2025 

  • Devtoberfest 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817 

SAP TechEd Agenda Builder 

  • Ceci’s blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/put-your-thinking-cap-on-it-s-time-to-make-some-tough-choices/ba-p/14211727 
  • SAP TechEd Session Catalog and Agenda Builder: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog 
  • SAP TechEd Berlin: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin.html 
  • SAP TechEd Virtual: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/virtual.html 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 CAP Aug 2025 release 

6:04 ABAP AI - Chapter 2 

7:25 SAP Business Data Cloud Series 

8:40 Devtoberfest 2025 

9:55 SAP TechEd Agenda Builder 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 11th, 2025.

[DJ] In case you missed it, the August 2025 release of CAP has landed with myriad updates. Now, this is going to be a slightly longer news item than usual, so grab a cup of tea and settle in. So, front and center for us all is the brand new cap≽ire organization on GitHub, which contains a reorganized set of repos, including individual sample repos, plus the cap≽ire documentation source repo itself, where contributions are welcome. Along with this reorganization comes continuous content deployments and a setup of package publication, which is great, not least for package reuse. And this cap≽ire organization is also the new home for discussions all around Cap. Check it out. So now in the new and recently GA, generally available topic, we can see that the previously beta-only support for persistent Fiori draft messages has now graduated and become GA. Also, there's a new MCP server for Cap that can provide AI-powered development help. Talking of GA in the language and compiler topic you may remember the introduction of support for expressions as first class annotation values well that support is also now GA. Staying in the language and compiler topic the query compiler has a new optimization for path expressions involving managed to one associations. A foreign key path expression is now translated to the local foreign key column instead of the joined remote one in the Node.js runtime this is now default and you can turn it on with a switch in the Java runtime. Now in a related update you can now collapse foreign key path expressions for managed to one associations into something simpler and let auto-coercion resolve this view into the more specific single foreign key specification like this example shown in a where clause. Now moving to the Node.js and Java runtimes there are plenty of updates too. Let's start with Node.js. There's a feature that was first introduced in the Java runtime back in April this year. This has also now been made available in Node.js. It's how elements that are annotated with common.txt are automatically included when a dollar search request is processed. Great stuff. There's also now a new database service level feature that allows you to stream query results direct from the persistence layer to the HTTP response, bypassing any need to materialize the result set in memory. There are also new features relating to requiring and connecting to remote services, a new utility method for working with linked definitions, and a new container for authentication-related information. And that's cdsuser.authinfo. This replaces the now deprecated cdsuser.tokeninfo. Moving to the Java runtime, there are quality of life, quality of dev life improvements when working with query results. For typed queries the results are automatically typed and you don't need to provide the access interface anymore if you're using the single list of or stream of methods. Now for single tenant applications, this is staying in a Java runtime right now, the feature attachment plugin now supports in an alpha version the SAP BTP object store and now you'll need a service binding to an object store backend. AWS's S3, Azure's blob storage, and Google's cloud storage are all supported. Now you may already know of CDS generate, part of the CDS Maven plugin, which automatically generates access interfaces for all structured CDS model types. This feature has been evolving and the team recommends you do use this as it brings benefits and in turn allows better compile time checking. Now, there's lots of detailed documentation on this, just waiting for your reading pleasure in cap≽ire, so go and check it out. Last but not least, there's now a convenience URL that you can directly select from the console log output, and it'll take you directly to the server's index page. Nice. Moving on to the tools area, the CDS plugin for IntelliJ is now at 2.0.0, and is now fully compatible with the free community edition of IntelliJ, which means that anyone and everyone can use IntelliJ for CAP development. The new 2.0.0 version brings lots of IDE features, lots of new features for the IDE, enhanced LSP integration and new options in the settings page. And there are also in the tools topic, new ESLint checks for JavaScript, making your life as a developer easier and the life of your code smoother. There are five safety checks so far, take a look in the cds lint section of cap hire. And last but certainly not least in this release there's been some awesome work in the area of GitHub actions, a new guide, sample workflows and lots more to help you manage test, deploy, package and release your CAP projects. Now that is cool. All this and more in the August 2025 release section of the CapHire documentation. Thanks, CapTeam.

 [Mamikee] Big news for ABAP developers. ABAP AI just keeps growing. Back in February, we announced that Joule speaks ABAP. Since then, there has been a wave of new AI-driven skills. Now, you can generate wrap business objects from the database table all the way to the UI service. You can create unit tests, explain code, complete code directly in the editor, and even implement validation and determination. These capabilities are already live in the SAP VTP ABAP environment and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. And they're coming to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in the 2025 release. Even better, ABAP AI remains free of charge. The free promotions we introduced earlier this year have been extended until further notice. And here is another big step forward. ABAP AI will also become available for older S/4HANA private releases. Think of an AI service running side-by-side with their ABAP instance. That means you can benefit from the latest innovations without waiting for an upgrade. Want the full details? You can stay tuned for TechEd 2025. And if you want to read more on these release updates, the link is in the description below.

[Witalij] SAP Business Data Cloud, BDC, brings a data product-centric approach to managing business data. Each data product is a curated, semantically enriched package of business process data, harmonized and replicated from systems like SAP S/4HANA. For solution developers and architects among here, BDC offers a standardized platform to build, extend, and consume these data products, exposing them through APIs or events for integration with both SAP and third-party applications. To dive deeper, check out the SAP Business Data Cloud blog series, including the latest post on customer-managed data products. You'll see how to build a custom data product in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using a custom CDS entity. There is also a dedicated series that walks through consuming data products in SAP Databricks for machine learning workflows and exposing them for inference. You'll find links to all these resources in the description. And as the Devtoberfest approaches, be sure to catch the sessions featuring product managers and the CTO of SAP Business Data Cloud.

[Daniel] SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin has just released the Agenda Builder, so you can now set your schedule for the event. Just scroll through all of the sessions, 250 keynotes, hands-on workshops, community talks, strategy talks, roadmaps and more. Select the ones that you like, click add to schedule and you're set to go. They are added to your dashboard. What's really great is that the sessions you would dream of missing are already in your schedule, like Key101, the Developer Keynote, run by a bunch of developer advocates you may recognize. If you're in Berlin, please drop by and say hello. If you can't make it to Berlin, you can still create an agenda for SAP TechEd Virtual, and the same Key101 Developer Keynote will be automatically added to your schedule. I love playing with the theme.

[Michelle]  Howdy y'all, everyone's favorite fall tech fest is just about to start. Devtoberfest 2025 kicks off on September 29th, which is only a few weeks away. Each day spotlights a different theme: ABAP, frontend tooling, AI, and more. As in years past, it's free and fully online, so jump in, earn points on the scoreboard, chase nirvana and put yourself in the running for the grand prize, which this year is a retreat to a future TechEd event and meet us developer advocates in person. Check out the post linked below for more info on the great sessions we've got coming up and the contest to see how you can win that fantastic grand prize. We hope you're just as excited to participate as we are to go live, and as always, happy coding!

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<targetsystem xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" desc="SOD TESTING NEW" id="ZTEST3" multisql="Yes" version="0000" xsi:schemaLocation="csa_policy.xsd">

entry.title: Approval Model Query Problem
entry.content:
Hi everyone,😱

I'm encountering an issue with the approval process in SAP Business One. I've configured a query to trigger approval only when at least one item in a sales quotation has a gross profit percentage below 27%.

The query checks each line individually, not the overall gross profit of the document. The idea is:

  • If any item has a gross profit percentage below 27%, the approval should be triggered.
  • If all items have a gross profit percentage above 27%, the approval should not be triggered — even if the total gross profit is affected by other items.

However, the main problem is that the approval still gets triggered even when all items have a gross profit percentage higher than 27%. I've also tested using other fields like StickPrice and LineTotal, but the issue persists.

It seems like the system is evaluating the total gross profit or applying the condition incorrectly. Has anyone faced this behavior or found a reliable way to ensure the approval only activates when at least one item falls below the threshold?

My actual query is this but i tried differents query fields but nothing.

SELECT DISTINCT 'TRUE' FROM OQUT T0  INNER JOIN QUT1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"      
WHERE T1."DocEntry" = T0."DocEntry"
AND T1."LineTotal"  > 0
AND T1."StickPrice" > 0
AND T1."Quantity" > 0 
AND ((T1."LineTotal" - (T1."Quantity" * T1."StickPrice"))   / NULLIF (T1."LineTotal", 0)) * 100 < 27

Version Sap 9.3 

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Re: Support and Technical Users
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

I hope you are well. 

The Support and Technical Users view allows you to display all support and technical users available in your system for compliance purposes. You cannot make any changes to the support and technical users in the system.

A support user can be a business partner who needs access to the system for development and maintenance reasons, whereas a technical user can be a process or service that is used to automate a technical task in the system, for example, a print user that is required to set up central printing using the Print Manager.

You can get more information over the following link below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_BUSINESS_BYDESIGN/2754875d2d2a403f95e58a41a9c7d6de/2dd49019722d101495caee46c29f0b7c.html?locale=en-US

Please also take a look on KBA below which has many FAQ related to this topic.

2608632 - Frequently Asked Questions on Identity and Access Management
https://me.sap.com/notes/2608632

Hope it can clarify your questions.

Regards,
Tiago
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Re: Production Order Cost Details for COGS Report
entry.content:
Hi @Jaavani_1016 ,

  1. Data Sources for Production Order Costs

For production order actual and planned costs, the following standard CDS views (and their underlying tables) are relevant:

Requirement

Standard CDS View

Backend Table(s)

Notes

Planned & actual cost by manufacturing order (ledger-specific)

I_MfgOrderActlPlanTgtLdgrCost

ACDOCA (universal journal), AUFK, AFPO

Needs ledger, version, and period selection.

Product cost collector actual/target cost

I_PCCActlTgtCostCube

ACDOCA, COSS/COSP, AUFK

Relevant if you’re using product cost collectors (repetitive manufacturing).

Order header details (customer, FG code, qty, R/C No)

I_ProductionOrder / I_MfgOrderItem

AUFK, AFPO

Links the controlling objects to material and customer.

Material master (FG code → part name)

I_MaterialText

MAKT

To get finished good description.

  1. Why You’re Not Seeing Data
  • Both I_MfgOrderActlPlanTgtLdgrCost and I_PCCActlTgtCostCube pull data from ACDOCA, but only if:
    • The order is settled or has postings (actual cost won’t exist if no confirmation, GI, or settlement done).
    • You use the right ledger (0L) and version (000 for actual, 001 for plan/target).
    • You provide fiscal year, period, and controlling area as parameters.

If you run without these, the CDS view often returns blank.

  1. Parameters Needed

For both CDS views, typically required filters are:

  • ControllingArea (KOKRS)
  • FiscalYear (GJAHR)
  • FiscalPeriod (POPER)
  • Ledger (e.g., 0L)
  • Version (000 = actuals, 001 = plan/target costs)
  • ManufacturingOrder (AUFNR)
  1. Report Layout Mapping

Report Field

Source

Customer

From sales order → I_SalesOrderItemCube joined with production order (settlement rule / account assignment)

SAP Finished goods code

I_ProductionOrder → Material

Part name

I_MaterialText (MAKT)

Qty

I_ProductionOrder (AFPO-GAMNG / delivered qty)

R/C No (Order No)

AUFNR from I_ProductionOrder

Planned cost

I_MfgOrderActlPlanTgtLdgrCost (Ledger=0L, Version=001)

Actual cost

I_MfgOrderActlPlanTgtLdgrCost (Ledger=0L, Version=000)

 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Hi Folks - Anyone using automation to setup bulk volu...
entry.content:
Hi @AnshulJ ,

Try below options:-

  1. Options for Bulk Company Code Setup
  2. a) SAP MDG – Central Governance
  • In MDG-F (Financials), company codes, charts of accounts, and financial org units can be created and governed as master data objects.
  • You can leverage:
    • File upload (Excel/CSV) via Data Import Framework (DIF).
    • SAP MDG Data Replication Framework (DRF) to replicate new company codes into S/4HANA (both GL & FPSL).
  • Good for controlled governance + approval workflows.
  1. b) Central Business Configuration (CBC)
  • CBC supports initial configuration during S/4HANA Cloud onboarding, but for mass company codes it’s still quite manual.
  • You can use “Copy Company Code” functionality in CBC but automating this for hundreds of entities is limited.
  • SAP recommends using Central Finance/MDG instead of CBC for large-scale automation.
  1. c) SAP S/4HANA APIs / BAPIs
  • For on-prem or private cloud, you can use:
    • BAPI_COMPANYCODE_CREATE1 – to create company codes.
    • BAPI_FLCU_CREATE / BAPI_FLCU_CHANGE – for customer-related financial data.
    • Custom ABAP programs / LSMW / LTMC / Migration Cockpit for initial loads.
  • Can be wrapped into Robotic Process Automation (SAP Build Process Automation / IRPA) to scale.
  1. d) FPSL Specific
  • FPSL (Financial Products Subledger) works with ledger groups and valuation areas.
  • You need to replicate company codes from MDG/S4 into FPSL’s Org Unit customizing tables.
  • Typically automated via:
    • ALE/IDoc replication (via DRF).
    • Custom mass upload programs delivered by SAP FPSL accelerator packs.
  1. Automation Tools in Practice
  • SAP Build Process Automation (BPA / IRPA) → Can record CBC or SPRO config steps and loop them for bulk company code creation.
  • SAP Solution Manager / ChaRM Transport Automation → Automates movement of customizing across systems.
  • SAP Landscape Transformation (SLT) → Not directly for company codes, but useful for replication scenarios.
  1. Best Practice Setup Flow
  1. Maintain company code master data in MDG-F (single source of truth).
  2. Use DRF replication to push into S/4HANA GL and FPSL customizing tables.
  3. For mass loads: use Migration Cockpit or custom ABAP BAPI loaders if MDG isn’t in scope.
  4. For automation at scale → wrap with BPA bots or API scripts.

 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Agentic AI – AI which finally makes sense?
entry.content:
“A computer can never be held accountable, therefore a computer must never make a management decision.” – IBM Training Manual, 1979[1][2]

So, where are we with AI now? Isn’t Agentic AI doing exactly what it isn’t supposed to do?

AI or ML or?

We are bombed with terms – small break! Let’s digest this grocery of terms…

  • Data Science[3] is a broad interdisciplinary scientific field using scientific methods to extract knowledge and insights from the massive data sets. It uses both; traditional data mining, data analysis and statistical methods; as well as ML techniques, to accomplish the given tasks.
  • AI (Artificial Intelligence) is the broadest concept, aiming to create machines that can "think" and perform human-like tasks.
  • ML (Machine Learning)[3] is a subset of AI where algorithms learn from data without explicit programming, enabling predictions and pattern recognition. It does need Data Science to be employed first to clean, prepare and analyze unstructured big data
  • Deep Learning[4] is a type of ML based on artificial neural networks impersonating human “thinking”.

Neither ML nor AI are something brand new. It is considered that earliest ML “program” was introduced in the early 1950s (by Arthur Samuel). Mid 1950s was the time when AI somehow emerged as well. However, only in 2000s ML/AI started being more popular – simply because machines could not cope with the complex ML/AI processing, before that time. The real break-through (sort-of) came only in 2012 with Deep-Learning. Everything else is now a “legend”…

Figure 1. Data Science as a discipline

Is this the correct relationship between ML and AI?

There are somewhat different views, but let’s stick with the one which is the most common; Deep Learning is a subset of ML, ML is subset of AI, and Data Science is here to “help” them all. Still let me just mention – some other interpretation would put “all” under umbrella of Dats Science, while some views say that AI is only “partially overlapping” with ML and Deep Learning. However, we will (at least in this article) stay with the relationships as presented in this diagram.

Generative AI

AI is great, but next big evolution happened with Generative AI (or GenAI)[5].

So, what is Generative AI? While AI is very broad field of computer science focused on enabling machines to perform human-like tasks, Generative AI is a specialized subset of AI (or Traditional AI, as often referred) that creates new, original content such as text, images, or music – impersonating human-like creativity.

When we talk about GenAI, sometimes we mixed it with LLM (Large Language Model) – but this is, of course, not correct. GenAI encompasses various forms of content generation, while LLM is a foundation model for NLP (Natural Language Processing) tasks – oriented to text understanding and generation only.

Both GenAI, in general, and LLM are in the essence based on Deep Learning models.

Figure 2. Generative AI

Whether we talk about text, or image or music creation, the flow is basically the same; there is a prompt (usually created by the user), invoking GenAI processing of the request to understand and generate appropriate content (i.e. text or answer on the specific inquiry), and finally there is a GenAI generated response returned to the requestor.

Agentic AI

And here we come to Agentic AI, next big hype – AI which makes sense? AI which can make actual decisions!

In general, it is scary – I admit. But at least, now we have a concept which can really, really be useful in the daily work. Do not take me wrong GenAI is also useful for quite a few things, but it was mostly limited to do some recommendations, suggestions etc.– it was more as an assistant helping us do the work, but we still had to make decisions and do the work by ourselves. But now with Agentic AI we actually have a tool which can make the decision and do the actual work. Yes, it is scary really – but it is a reality, as well…

Agentic AI[6][7] is an AI system, with enhanced autonomy, enabling it to independently set goals, make decision on it, plan actions accordingly, and finally execute necessary tasks, without human intervention. Unlike Traditional AI, or “only” Generative AI, Agentic AI Systems are capable to understand complex context, learn from the interactions, and adapt to changing conditions. Within its “core”, Agentic AI Systems integrate LLMs – to work together with other agents. Agents can be other ML models, but those could be also calls to external tools (i.e. like API calls, DB actions etc.). In the system, through AI Orchestration each agent is performing specific subset of tasks required to reach the overall goal.

Figure 3. Agentic AI System has “brain”, “memory” and “tools”

It is exactly because of “agents” working with LLM “brain”, this approach is demonstrating high autonomy in solving problems; from understanding the context, invoking the right agents to perform “micro” tasks; aggregating all results, measure the success rate in meeting the goal, make the decision and execute the actions.

Agentic AI is focused on decisions as opposed to creating the content, like GenAI. Agentic AI does not rely on human prompts and does not require human supervision. But Agentic AI and GenAI tools work together, each of them takes their own role. In fact, Agentic AI could not do what it does, if there are no GenAI capabilities – core of the Agentic AI System relies on GenAI to make actions on the initial prompts (or inputs invoking specific agents via AI Orchestration), evaluating responses received form the agents, and generating final human-like responses on the prompts (if such actions is needed).

Figure 4. An example of steps within Agentic AI System

In real terms, the process could look like this:

  1. Agentic AI System uses its brain (i.e. LLMs) to understand the context (i.e. understand that prompt is asking for the specific Sales Order status) and generate the content for the external tool agents (i.e. API call to the ERP system).
  2. Usually, Agentic AI System will also have memory to store past context – to be smarter with similar prompts in future.
  3. AI Orchestration will invoke tools which will perform specific tasks (i.e. read the Sales Order detail from the ERP system, read LMD delivery status, retrieve knowledge from RAG or simply engage other agent) and return the results to the brain.
  4. All responses will be aggregated (i.e. if we are invoking several tools).
  5. Agentic AI brain may evaluate the conditions (if met) or it may measure success rate toward set goals (if satisfaction level reached).
  6. At the end, Agentic AI brain may trigger some actions, including providing response to the requester –this time it will create the content (i.e. human-like response with the Sales Order status).

Another typical example would be autonomous vehicles (or self-driving cars), where car AI must understand the complex context of the surrounding driving conditions, take the necessary inputs, and act toward reaching the goal. In this process car AI will make autonomous driving decisions and steer the vehicle accordingly.

This is why Agentic AI is Ai which actual does make sense – as it actually can work for us… Of course, will it (eventually) work only for us – this is completely different topic – which I will try to address in the separate article.

Some more practical examples, addressing some additional topics about A2A, MCP including some SAP specific topics like Content Based Agents vs. Code Based Agents – I will also try to cover in the separate article.

And don’t worry. Agentic AI is current hype – but AI is evolving, there will more and more “hypes” in the future, I am quite certain…

Final Thoughts

So, Agentic AI makes decisions – and not only that, but they also execute actions! Let’s think about future and “real” self-driving cars!

Then, are we actually violating the principles set by IBM in 1979? I am not going to answer this question, but answer seems to be quite straight-forward, right?

Welcome to the future…

Acknowledgment

*) Intro photo by Nahrizul Kadri on Unsplash

**) This article uses SAP Business Technology Platform Solution Diagrams & Icons as per SAP Terms of Use  governing the use of these SAP Materials (please note, newer version of the Solution Diagrams & Icons, as well as Terms of Use, might be in place after the publication of this article).

More guidelines on Solution Diagrams & Icons can be found in this article by Bertram Ganz.

References

[1] IBM: AI decision-making: Where do businesses draw the line? | IBM

[2] LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7271085510142439426/

[3] IBM: Data science vs. machine learning: What's the Difference? | IBM

[4] Wikipedia: Deep learning - Wikipedia

[5] Forbes: The Difference Between Generative AI And Traditional AI: An Easy Explanation For Anyone

[6] IBM: What Is Agentic AI? | IBM

[7] IBM: Agentic AI vs. Generative AI | IBM

entry.title: Re: delete a user in sap lms
entry.content: @user116, it's possible that this user isn't a Learning only user anymore. In the Learning Administration area > In the user record > "User Details" tab > A note should be displayed stating something like "Certain fields on the page are read-only because they contain HR data and should be maintained in your core HR system of record". This means this user exists in BizX as well. The deletion of users under this scenario needs to take place in BizX, via DRTM (KBA 2615360). For Learning only users (not existing in BizX), you may advance with the "Native User Deletion" automatic process (KBA 2515540).

entry.title: Como criar blogs incríveis a partir das palestras dos eventos SAP?
entry.content:
@moshenaveh compartilhou uma metodologia prática para transformar apresentações de eventos em blogs rápidos e envolventes. Eis os passos-chave:

1️⃣Use o tutorial do SAP Community para habilitar o blogging.
2️⃣Crie um template dedicado ao evento (pré e pós-evento).
3️⃣Transforme sua apresentação em texto com apoio de IA.
4️⃣Revise gramática/estilo com ferramentas de IA.
5️⃣Enriqueça com imagens, slides e mídia.
6️⃣Seja transparente → use a tag GenAIAssistedContent.
7️⃣Publique na seção correta da comunidade.
8️⃣Promova nas redes sociais e interaja nos comentários.

Essa abordagem reduz o tempo de criação de horas para minutos, motiva mais palestrantes a compartilhar conhecimento  e amplia o impacto das sessões.

Que tal aplicar essas dicas no próximo evento que você participar?

Vejam este blog como exemplo criado a partir de palestras realizadas

entry.title: Re: Transport of analytical query variants
entry.content:
Hello customer,

Indeed, the recommendations to transport analytical queries bookmarks/variants is outlined in the KBA 0003361686: Bookmarks transportation guidance.

Transporting bookmarks is not possible in releases lower than SAP_BW 757. This new functionality is available only from SAP_BW 757 release.

Only public bookmarks can be transported. Transport of BW Bookmarks is possible via two ABAP reports:

  • FPM_BICS_TRANSPORT_BOOKMARKS: Collect the desired Bookmarks in a customizing request in the source system. The customizing request can be then released via transaction SE09.
  • FPM_BICS_IMPORT_BOOKMARKS: Import the transported Bookmarks into the BICS environment of the target system.

Refer to SAP Note 3336542 - BICS Data Grid: Transport of Bookmarks.

Best Regards,
SAP Support
